snippet: A disclosure of e-mails showed the White House was more involved in revising talking points about the attack in Benghazi, Libya, than officials have previously acknowledged.
abstract: Disclosure of e-mails show White House was more deeply involved in revising talking points about attack in Benghazi, Libya, than officials have previously acknowledged; e-mails, which administration turned over to Congress, show White House coordinating an intensive process with the State Department, CIA, FBI and other agencies to obtain final version of the talking points, used by Susan E Rice, ambassador to the United Nations, in television appearances after the attack.

byline.contributor: Peter Baker and Eric Schmitt contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: A disclosure of e-mails showed the White House was more involved in revising talking points about the attack in Benghazi, Libya, than officials have previously acknowledged.

headline.seo: Benghazi E-Mails Put White House on the Defensive
headline.main: Benghazi E-Mails Put White House on the Defensive
headline.print_headline: Benghazi E-Mails Put White House on the Defensive
